comments.body: How about a validator to ensure that worker configs are valid before the DistributedWorker starts instantiating its components and throwing IllegalArgumentExceptions?
not sure if this was intended to apply to both connect protocol and scheduled rebalance max delay, but validator on the delay would make sense as well -- at a minimum to ensure non-negative

Added a validation and a validator class that can allow anyone to write a Validator in place. I think this is useful and will help with easy addition of validations, that currently are missing from several places. 

I believe this part belongs to a separate PR with a jira ticket that informs for the addition of what I called `LambdaValidator`. But before I create this I'd like to get some feedback here. WDYT @rhauch ?

Comments are not in chronological order :) I hope you find inline validations useful and we can keep this. 
Should I submit another PR with some unit tests?
The use of multiple multi-line lambdas within does make this harder to read. What do you think about making protected static helper method similar to `validateSignatureAlgorithm(...)`?
How about some unit tests that check this logic, especially that invalid config values fail as expected?
Is SASL support significantly different and only needed in distributed mode?

Good question. SASL support is different in that it's only useful for connecting to Kafka, as opposed to SSL, which can also be used for performing authentication at the REST API level. But both types of worker should support all SASL-related configs since they both do connect to Kafka.

However, as far as I can tell, the lack of definition for SASL-related configs in the `StandaloneConfig` class isn't causing any bugs at the moment, so in order to be conservative with the changes here I opted to just move the SSL-related configs into the parent config class.

I think there's a lot of configs that are defined in the `DistributedConfig` class that would make more sense in the `WorkerConfig` class, and possibly some configs in the `WorkerConfig` class that are really only relevant for distributed mode (`rest.advertised.*` seems strange, given that standalone workers don't have any other workers to advertise their URLs to...). We can address all of that here if there are other issues caused by them, but if it's more of a stylistic thing and it's alright with you, I think a follow-up ticket for cleaning up where we define these configs might be a better way to handle the non-urgent work and get in this somewhat-more-urgent fix now. WDYT?
